arm_group.description: Ketamine:  (dose 0.3 mcg/kg) included in  physiological solution at 0.9% (250 ml)  during 2 hours, intravenously.
Control group: only physiological solution at 0.9% (250 ml)  during 2 hours, intravenously.

brief_summary.textblock:
- Cognitive changes are related to aging, affecting  the performance of older patients in
      the solution of problems and the execution of tasks.

      This phenomenon has been observed  as a decline of neurophysiological domains, especially
      memory, and the velocity of thought.

        -  Anesthesia and surgery performed contributes to its development  then, is named
           post-operative cognitive dysfunction (POCD). The incidence varies due to conditions of:

             1. Anesthesia and surgery.

             2. The time elapsed after surgery.

             3. The population studied, and the type of cognitive test employed.

        -  The aim of this study is to evaluate the protective effect of ketamine on acute POCD on
           the common  conditions of geriatric patients, —comorbid and settings as minor
           surgery—submitted to ophthalmic surgery

clinical_study.brief_title: Ketamine and Acute Postoperative Cognitive Dysfunction

detailed_description.textblock:
Participants will be patients programmed for a vitrectomy or cataract surgery involving a
      retrobulbar block, to be carried out with a local anesthesia.

      - Administration of ketamine will be suspended during the study for any cause considered as
      a risk to the patient according to the judgment of the researchers.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients be over 60 years and older.

          -  Intraocular pressure less than 20 millimeter of mercury.

          -  American Society of Anaesthesiologists (ASA) physical status classification, I-III.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  History of psychosis or schizophrenia.

          -  Nephropathy.

          -  Difficult to control hypertension.

          -  Uncontrolled hepatic disorders.

          -  Allergy to ketamine.

          -  Moderate to severe depression.

          -  Post-operative delirium.

          -  Needed to use medications other than those contemplated in the study.

intervention.description: Ketamine: (dose 0.3 mcg/kg) included in physiological solution at 0.9% (250 ml) during 2 hours, intravenously.
physiological solution at 0.9% (250 ml)  during 2 hours, intravenously, with the same physical characteristics of ketamine.

facility.name: Centro Medico Nacional Siglo XXI. UMAE Hospital de Especialidades

clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Ketamine Administered During Ophthalmic Surgery in Protection Against Acute Postoperative Cognitive Dysfunction in Geriatric Patients

oversight_info.authority: Mexico: Federal Commission for Protection Against Health Risks

primary_outcome.description: Patients were included in an analysis of mean change from preoperative to postoperative assessment of the number of items missed on the SPMSQ using analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) model which contained baseline status as covariate, and the treatment group as the effect of interest.
primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to postoperative endpoint error scores on the Short Portable Mental Status Questionnaire (SPMSQ) in both groups

secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of changes over time in hemodynamic parameters was done during the surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, after Retrobulbar block , 90 minutes into surgery.

secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of changes over time in respiratory rate was done during the surgery with a general lineal model.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, after Retrobulbar block , 90 minutes into surgery.

secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of changes over time in oxygen saturation measures was done during the surgery with a general lineal model
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, after Retrobulbar block , 90 minutes into surgery.

secondary_outcome.description: Sedation according to the Ramsey Scale from baseline to the final assessment (90minutes into surgery), was done with a general lineal model.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, after retrobulbar block, 90 minutes into surgery

secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of change in intraocular pressure  over time was done previous retrobulbar block and at the end of surgery with a general lineal model over non-surgical eye.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (previous Retrobulbar block), end of surgery.

secondary_outcome.description: Analgesia was evaluated after regional anesthesia (retrobulbar block) and after surgery, a comparison was made between groups by the Chi-squared test (χ2).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes in analgesia after regional anaesthesia (retrobulbar block). Changes in analgesia over 30 minutes after surgery.
